attributes.action: Create a separate PIP assesment for mental disabilities
attributes.background: The current PIP assessment is designed for physical disabilities and does not ask the correct questions for people with mental health issues. Therefore people with mental health issues are loosing out on funds they are entiltled too. MENTAL HEALTH MATTERS

attributes.action: Stop classifying cats as "property" under UK law
attributes.background: Recently in the U.K. there have been a number of cases of people killing cats, U.K. Law means these people are only charged with damage to property, the law needs changing to reflect reality, that cats are not property but family members.
attributes.additional_details: The law for a long time has failed animals, we now need to start punishing these crimes accordingly. There is an acknowledged link between animal cruelty and violence against other humans, another reason that classifying a breathing living creature as "property" is barbaric.

attributes.action: Thinner lenses be free on the NHS for those registered partially sighted/blind
attributes.background: I was registered as partially sighted at 16 and blind at 19. My eyesight is constantly deteriorating and at a quicker pace than most. The need for glasses is essential. I now require complex lenses, thinner lenses are essential and they are very costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Those with complex lenses do get a voucher but that only equates to approximately £14. One pair of glasses cost me nearly £300.

The buy one get one free offers advertised do not include thinner lenses so if a second pair is required (eg prescription sunglasses which with some conditions light has a major impact) you have to pay twice for the lenses.

I currently have thinner lenses in my latest pair and from the side they are at least 0.75cm thick so would be considerably worse without

attributes.action: Amend animal welfare act to ban the practice of giving away animals as prizes.
attributes.background:
Calling upon the ban of ALL animals given as prizes to any age not just under the age of 16. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 in England and Wales makes it an offence to give away an animal as a prize if the person can reasonably be believed to be under 16 and is not accompanied by an adult.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the case in Scotland, where under the Animal Health and Welfare (Scotland) Act 2006, it is an offence to offer or give an animal to another person as a prize (whatever their age), except where it is offered in a family context.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to dump animals.
attributes.background: Many charities like Animal Aid have to rescue many dumped kittens and puppies on a daily basis because of people just abandoning them on the street in a box. I want it to be illegal to dump animals and for people who do to be never allowed to have pets again.

attributes.action: Create an awareness campaign to highlight  the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background:
Type 1 diabetes is on the increase in the UK, the biggest increase is in children, especially those under the age of 5 years old.
Unfortunately many people are unaware of the symptoms which can lead to deadly results. A delay in diagnosis can be fatal, children are dying needlessly.
attributes.additional_details:
Type 1 diabetes is a condition which is completely mis-understood, it has nothing to do with lifestyle, which is a common misconception. It complicates even the most simplest of tasks. 
There has never been a campaign that educates parents and medical professionals in the symptoms of Type 1 diabetes. Once diagnosed, and with the correct treatment and support nothing is impossible. You only have to look at our Prime Minister. 
Education is the key.

attributes.action: Make more treatments available on the NHS for Lipoedema patients.
attributes.background: Lipoedema is a genetic adipose tissue disorder which causes patients legs & arms to grow largely out of proportion. This can be an incredibly painful, embarrassing & debilitating condition. It's estimated to affect 11% of women worldwide
attributes.additional_details: The only way to effectively treat this condition is surgery. It doesn't just effect women, lipoedema can effect men as well. Patients with Lipoedema have painful, enlarged, lumpy, misshaped and often badly bruised arms and legs. Currently patients are left to suffer as the disfiguration of the limbs becomes more pronounced, the pain increases and their mobility and enjoyment of everyday activities decreases. Please sign this petition and get the Lipoedema patients the treatment they deserve.

attributes.action: Follow France and force shops to donate food waste to charities.
attributes.background:
Every year in the UK 18 million tonnes of food end up in landfill.

Approx 1/3 from producers/ supply chain, 1/3 from retail and 1/3 from households.

Annual value : £23 BILLION 

Disposal costs to business passed on to consumers in higher prices, landfill costs in local taxes – less income
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/may/22/uk-tops-chart-of-eu-food-waste

http://www.foodawarecic.org.uk/stats-2/

attributes.action: Ultra sound scans of ovaries as part of the smear screening process
attributes.background: My name is Sam. I'm a 31 year old mother of 2. I've always stayed up to date with my checks. Having had a baby 8 month ago delivered by c section I had a tender pain in my abdomen still to this day. After being admitted to A&E suspected appendicitis. It turns out I have a 17cm cyst on my ovary
attributes.additional_details:
If it wasn't for the sharp pain I experienced one day. I would never have know about this cyst. I have an appointment now to have a full hysterectomy (my choice as I want no risk of anything returning). As the cyst is classed as suspicious. 
I believe if you arrange for ultra sounds to be done at the same appointment as women having smear tests. We can reduce the risk of other women living with these possibly life threatening undetected growths.

attributes.action: Intervene  NOW with the Government of Indonesia to  reprieve Lindsay SandIford
attributes.background: The severity of the sentence was greeted with shock because prosecutors had not recommended the death penalty for Sandiford. The ruling was also condemned by the British government and anti–death penalty campaigners. It's also contrary to International Law, which we should uphold and enforce!
attributes.additional_details: Guardian articles , 28 April 2016,and 14 June 2016. Wickipaedia entry "Linsay Sandiford. Numerous other press reports in all reputable newspapers and international media

attributes.action: Revoke and Repeal the Act of Union 1707 (Treaty of Union)
attributes.background: In 1707 two Acts of Parliament was formed. This is called the 'Treaty of Union'. Revoke that Act to renegotiated and push for separate independent states. ie a 'United England'
attributes.additional_details: The Acts of Union were two Acts of Parliament: the Union with Scotland Act 1706 passed by the Parliament of England, and the Union with England Act passed in 1707 by the Parliament of Scotland. They put into effect the terms of the Treaty of Union that had been agreed on 22 July 1706, following negotiation between commissioners representing the parliaments of the two countries. By the two Acts, the Kingdom of England and the Kingdom of Scotland—which at the time were separate states with separate legislatures, but with the same monarch—were, in the words of the Treaty, "United into One Kingdom by the Name of Great Britain"

attributes.action: STOP the roll out of PIP in Scotland until the new Scottish benefit agency opens
attributes.background: Currently the Conservatives are rolling out PIP around Scotland affecting millions of people but I think this should be stopped in Scotland until the new Scottish benefit agency in announced and operating

attributes.action: Make the taking of fish from all privately owned waters a criminal offence
attributes.background: Fishing is the most participated sport in the UK, however, the illegal removal of fish from privately owned lakes is having a devastating impact on the future of all angling, the cost of replacing stolen fish is crippling local clubs and associations lakes and must be stopped

attributes.action: Support our teachers in the UK and protect our children's education.
Bring VAT back down to 15% immediately after EU exit has been completed
attributes.background: Give honest working UK tax payers and families a much needed economical boost and shot in the arm. With new global trade deals now possible and a recouped EU membership bill lets force competition in the market place and give the consumer a chance to really contribute to incrrasing overall GDP

attributes.action: Fathers should automatically be granted 50% custody of their children by law
attributes.background: At present a father needs to fight to have 50% access to their child. A child that is legally a mother and fathers. A child needs a father just as much as a mother and the current legislation is not only stuck in the dark ages but favours considerably the mother. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Direct Councils to use the Mobile Home powers devolved to them, without option.
attributes.background: A 'criminal element' have been acquiring Sites. They use brutal intimidation to frighten elderly residents and they ignore any regulations. Although Councils have enormous powers under Planning and Licencing  they are reluctant to get involved, even when there is overwhelming evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The main legislation is the 1960 Caravan Act, the 1983  Mobile Home Act and the 2013 Mobile Home Act. Councils have been lethargic and even negligent in their policing of these Acts. 

There is a Parliamentary Working Group monitoring the 2013 Act, but they are not going to report until July 2017. The legislation must be made to work now and the rouges must either change their ways, or be relieved of the ownership of their Sites. Too many elderly residents are suffering hardship and abuse.

attributes.action: Include third sector workers on SOL to prevent them being forced out of the UK
attributes.background:
Tier 2 skilled workers must meet a £35k p/a salary threshold to remain in the UK. This makes it impossible for them to work in 3rd sector roles.
The Shortage Occupation List has been used to prevent nurses being removed from the UK. It must now be used to save charity workers, and charities.
attributes.additional_details:
Charities, voluntary organisations and social enterprises desperately need Tier 2 skilled workers, especially in IT etc, but can't match  private or civil sector salaries to entice the best workers.
It is impossible for a Tier 2 worker to switch to a Tier 5 route, which forbids a permanent job.
The Home Office must ask the Migration Advisory Committee to research the possibility of including third sector workers on the SOL.
Find out moreat stop35k.org

attributes.action: Referendum on the renewal of the Trident nuclear submarine programme
attributes.background: We should be able to make the decision on whether or not the UK Government spends billions of pounds on the Trident nuclear missile programme, or if we would like it to be spent elsewhere within our economy as some sources estimate that renewal could be upwards of £200bn.

attributes.action: Make the 5th of July NHS day, and a national holiday.
attributes.background: I feel that many now, so far on from it's inception truly understand a lot about when and how it started. As a whole, we just take it for granted, and have become blase about it. Yet it's treated all of us, saved lives, including my own, and more than once. It deserves to be celebrated by us all.

attributes.action: Relieve Capita of their contract for assessing disabled people
attributes.background: Relieve Capita of their contract for assessing disabled people on the back of the revelations revealed in the Channel 4 Dispatches program that was aired on the 11th April 2016

attributes.action: Auto British Citizenship for EU Citizens working here for more than 10 years.
attributes.background: Give automatic British Citizenship to EU Nationals living and working in the UK for more than 10 years that never committed a crime and never claimed benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The current process to obtain British Citizenship is outdated, too expensive and does not reward law abiding EU citizens that have been working in the UK for a long time and contributing to the wealth and cultural richness of the UK. 

EU Citizens should not need to pay for ESOL Tests if they been living here for so long and have other UK qualifications at Level 2 or above. 

Work and tax records should be checked by simply asking the applicant to provide their National Insurance Number.

attributes.action: Educate students about mortgages/taxes/life skills etc in college/high school
attributes.background: Learning about mortgages etc should be compulsory for students as I don't know what it is, how it works etc and I'm in college. This gives the students better skills for life than what is currently taught in their citizenship/pshce lessons

attributes.action: Rectify a disparity in MOD regulations over the use of Unit badges on memorials.
attributes.background: The three Services have their own rules for which names, Crests or Unit Badges can be used on private, family instigated memorials and/or their headstone, post mortem. The Royal Navy and Army state that any amount of service is acceptable, where as the RAF can require as much as 20 years service

attributes.action: Introduce a legal ratio of nurse to patient.
attributes.background: Something I have witnessed not only as a Healthcare Assistant but also as a student nurse is the increasing number of patients a Staff Nurse is being forced to care for. The government need to recognise this is wrong and jeopardising patient safety! Make the legal limit 1 Nurse: 8 Patients.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm a student nurse who is looking to work for the NHS once I qualify, however, this growing number of patients that Nurses are being made to look after TERRIFIES me! 
There needs to be a limit put in place to safeguard Nurses and patients. It isn't safe to have up to 12 patients to 1 Nurse. 
Avoidable mistakes are being made daily on wards due to low levels of staffing! 
Imagine it was your mother, father, nan or grandad who was admitted to hospital where the Nurse can't give them the best care

attributes.action: Make School Allergy Action Groups Standard Practice for All Schools in the UK
attributes.background: Cases of Anaphylaxis are rising in the UK. Schools have a statutory duty of care to support children with medical conditions. Allergies can be life threatening. We believe every school should adopt good practice in the way of School Allergy Action Groups as soon as practically possible.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are still left to write their own health and safety policies including those relating to allergies within the school setting. Adopting good practice (such as advocated by Allergy UK) in setting up School Allergy Action Groups/SAAG will enable school staff, pupils, parents, governors and providers (e.g.caterers) to collaborate in ensuring school is as safe as possible for those affected by life threatening allergies. It will reduce risks, save time, money and potentially lives.

attributes.action: Change  'Assaulting a Police Officer' to Assaulting Emergency Services personnel
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted across the country leaving them with severe injurys that stop them from doing the amazing work they do. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Office has for many years.
attributes.additional_details: Across the news the past month, story's are arising of emergency services Personel being assaulted while carrying out the jobs. Ambulance staff that are there to treat and help people are being assaulted leaving them with serious injurys that stop them from working. The law should be changed to help combat the disgusting behaviour that is being seen across the country.

attributes.action: We call on the Government to offer anonymity to victims of revenge porn
attributes.background:
Last year the Coalition made it illegal to disclose private sexual photographs and videos with intent to cause distress. 

Offering anonymity to victims empowers them to come forward to get justice. They shouldn't have to suffer in silence to protect any privacy they have left.

attributes.action: Training to raise awareness of disability in the workplace and schools
attributes.background: Personally due to my own experience, I feel employers need an overview of how disabilities can affect someone. Also when a manager doesn’t know how to deal with someone with health issues, the easy route out is constructive dismissal instead of supporting.
attributes.additional_details: This is all due to lack of education or understanding. The Government should make workplace training about disability mandatory to raise awareness in the whole company. Schools should also have disability training as part of the national curriculum. This could change people’s attitudes towards disability.

attributes.action: Raise minimum wage of 18-20 year olds to that of 21 year olds
attributes.background: The current minimum wage for 18-20 year olds in the UK is £5.30. The current minimum wage for 21- 24 year olds is £6.70. This is a huge gap even though the cost of living is exactly the same; the cost of food, rent and bills is not lower - so why is the rate of pay?
attributes.additional_details: For every 40 hours a 21 year old works, an 18 year old has to work an additional 10 hours to earn the same amount of money - this is essentially an extra week's worth of work every month.18-20 year olds are constantly exploited in the workplace because of this. Working for 200 hours pays around £1,060 before tax and national insurance, working for the recommended 160 hours pays around £870. For a whole month this is not enough for an independent person to live off.

attributes.action: Regulate political campaign material and communications
attributes.background:
In the most recent UK referendum on membership of the EU, campaign materials & messages on both sides contained gross mistruths, irregularities and exaggeration.

Citizens must be able to rely on campaign messages which are clear, factual and informative so that we can submit fully informed votes
attributes.additional_details: The Electoral Commission regulates a lot of the process around elections & voting, but there is currently no regulation from any body on political campaign materials and messages. I propose that the EC's remit is extended to regulate this as well. This would enable the voting public to execute their democratic right in a fully informed way. As to ask people to make an important choice on anything other than independently-verified facts & information runs the risk of destabilising our democracy.

attributes.action: Link time of raising earning threshold for Carers Allowance with the Living wage
attributes.background: Currently earnings after allowable deductions must be no more that £110 pw but because the National Living Wage for over 25s is £7.20hr. This means someone working 16 hrs a week will earn £115.20 per week. £5.20 more than the amount allowed to earn and are at risk of losing their Carer's Allowance
attributes.additional_details:
Unpaid carers save the UK £132 billion a year. For 2015/16, the overall NHS budget was around £116.4 billion. This comparison alone illustrates the net-worth of Carers and their contribution to the economy. It is therefore not unreasonable to suppose the Government values their worth and shows it in a meaningful way.

This petition calls on the Chancellor of the Exchequer to link the time of raising the earnings threshold for Carer's Allowance with that of the Living Wage rise.

attributes.action: Keep breast screening at 47 or younger to help save lives!
attributes.background: My sister was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer at 48. If she hadnt been screened this early she might not have been here today. I had  breast screening at 47 and was diagnosed with primary breast cancer, if I hadn't been seen until 50, it would have been much worse. Screening early is essential.
attributes.additional_details: Early detection of breast cancer can mean less money being spent by the NHS. Less chemotherapy needed. Less drugs needed. Consultants would rather catch cancers early so why are the NHS taking the age back up 50? My sister and I will be doing more research into this. But we want to get the petition up.and running a soon as possible.  Cancer destroys whole families. Dont let the NHS trust go backwards in cancer detection!

attributes.action: Change the law to introduce restrictions on where convicted paedophiles can live
attributes.background: Following recently finding out a paedophile was living on my street, a street not only full of children but also by a primary school. It got me thinking how many more situations are like this and that there should be tighter restrictions to protect children.

attributes.action: More support for people underweight (programs/support groups)
attributes.background: I lost a lot of weight and dropped to 5st 4... I see weight watchers and slimming world all over but theirs nothing for people underweight! I am a one woman army trying to get heard. I was in the daily mail with my story now I want to help others!
attributes.additional_details: Theirs 13,000 weight watchers meetings happening every week yet for underweight people there's a hotline to call which is only open for 9 hours!

attributes.action: Prevent Ministers and MP's to talk until debate runs out of time.
attributes.background: The Government to impose a time restriction on Ministers and MP's to talk in Private Members Bills debates in line with the time given to debate. The current system gives members the opportunity to talk until time runs out, shelving the debate. This is not democratic and discredits the system.
attributes.additional_details: The current system allows for Ministers and Members of Parliament to be able to talk out Private Members Bills when they know they are running out of time. Placing time restrictions on Members of Parliament and Ministers in attendance of the debate in relation to the time that can be given to a debate (minimum or maximum) to stop shelving Bills. Bills should be voted on in Parliament whether they progress to the next stage or refused without a third option, to talk out a debate.

attributes.action: Make it law for MPs to see Constituents whether they support them or not
attributes.background: During the Waspi campaign M.P.s have refused to see their Constituents as they don't support the issue.Also, they did not hand in the paper petitions to the House of Commons 11/10/16 and other M.P.s had to do this for them

attributes.action: Refund visa applicants who have paid the IHS and then contributed towards NI
attributes.background: I am a British citizen living and working in the UK with my South African-born husband and 2 children who are here on spousal/dependant visas. Both my husband and I have been working here for the past 2 and a half years and paying National Insurance.
attributes.additional_details: Last year, an Immigration Health Surcharge was introduced for all non EEA persons applying for visas to come to the UK for more than 6 months in order to cover the NHS. My family are about to apply for Further Leave to Remain and we now have to fork out £1500 for the IHS. I understand the need to charge for the use of the NHS, but what I fail to understand is why we can’t claim this back as a tax refund at the end of the year when we are paying £7872 pa into National Insurance.

attributes.action: REMOVE THE TRIDENT MISSILE SYSTEM AND ALL THE NUCLEAR SUBMARINES FROM SCOTLAND.
attributes.background: Trident is a WMD and the people of Scotland do not want it housed in their back gardens. We seek the urgent removal of this obscene weapon from Scottish waters.

attributes.action: Legally require force food suppliers to label all halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.background:
I am not Muslim, i do not wish to eat halal meat, l do not agree with it religiously & ethically, i support animal rights.
I have accidentally eaten halal meat and this caused me religious and ethical issues and has deeply offended me, i demand ALL shops clearly label halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco- "we do not specify to suppliers whether halal practices should be followed"
M&S-  "we do not specify any religious practice as part of our sourcing policy so therefore do not label"

Sainsburys- "in NZ it is common for lamb to be blessed"

Morrisons- "all our lamb from NZ is pre-stunned and blessed"

Co-Op- "there is currently no UK wide labelling scheme"

ASDA- "No comment"

Waitrose- " there is currently no UK labelly scheme and we believe this is a matter where government should lead "

attributes.action: Make a National Doctors' Day
attributes.background: Doctors provide care with altruistic values. Some countries like USA, India and Iran recognise their doctors with a special day. Such a day would recognise doctors' contribution to society.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1933, USA has been celebrating a national doctors' day on 9th May, signed in law by President George Bush in 1990. Iran recognises famous physician, Avicenna and celebrates his birthday as doctors' day. In UK, Such a celebration will help doctors build their self-esteem and create a binding relationship between doctors and their patients. 
It should not a national holiday but a day of celebration and acknowledgement in hospitals and GP surgeries, just like nurses day (12th May).

attributes.action: Change the NHS dental provision so everyone has access. We've already paid.
attributes.background:
Nhs dentistry should be available for all.
People are anable to access routine and emergency NHS dental care when needed.
Children have toothache, a preventable disease.
Toothache is agonising - easily fixed. People extract using pliers 
Funding is being diverted from dental commissioning
attributes.additional_details:
Work started in Dewsbury tackling access to dental provision in Dec. 15. The audit is published here:

http://therealjunktoothproject.org/news/

We engaged with local people in need of help. 

We have worked with The Real Junk Food Project Dewsbury CIC to engage with people who we are 'recruiting to eat food'. If they can't afford to eat, they can't afford private healthcare to sort out teeth. 

We need a people focused response and positive action.

attributes.action: Provide Orkambi for Cystic Fibrosis patients in England.
attributes.background: Orkambi (ivacaftor and lumacaftor) is a gene therapy based drug used to help treat CF for the most common gene (deltaF508). Use in Cystic patients can reduce lung function decline from 2.3% annually to 1.3% a significant improvement over the course of a cystics life.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37795460

attributes.action: Establish a day for the NHS as a public holiday to celebrate Britain at its best
attributes.background: We currently lack a national holiday. Recent events show how uniquely the NHS unites people across political divides. The 70th anniversary of the NHS is in 2018. We can celebrate annually something which shows us at our best. The whole nation made and protects the NHS, and it cares for all of us.
attributes.additional_details:
Our NHS was declared the best healthcare system in a respected international survey of different services. It came top for quality, access and efficiency, in spite of spending the second lowest amount per person.

(See: The Commonwealth Fund (2014) Mirror, Mirror on the Wall, 2014 Update: How the U.S. Health Care System Compares Internationally, Washington D.C.)

attributes.action: Replace the current First Past The Post System with Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: The current system of FPTP is leaving Local Elections in England and Wales with abnormal results. parties are gaining a higher percentage of seats compared with the actual vote they receive, which is leaving the majority of voters unrepresented at Council level.
attributes.additional_details:
For example, in Castle Point, a party achieved 37% of the vote but gained 60% of the seats, while another party there achieved 31% of the vote but gains no seats.

In Oldham, 49.1% of the vote was enough to gain 75% of the seats available.

We are calling for a fairer system to be put in place so that every vote counts.

attributes.action: Update Psychiatric Diagnosis Procedures so they are accountable & evidence-based
attributes.background: Psychiatry is under criticism for its subjectivity and unaccountability.Brief crises are defined as lifelong conditions.There is no recognition of this ambiguity.Complaints are seen as symptoms.Patients are misunderstood or slandered.The pessimism of working in a Hospital causes Confirmation Bias.

attributes.action: Let learner riders over 25 ride a 250cc on L plates
attributes.background: Older riders have more sense and control than younger riders and with bike specs getting safer bigger bikes for older riders will bring down the amount of accidents we feel the law should change on the cc learners can ride
attributes.additional_details: It's proven that the bigger cc bikes have more chance of getting out of situations than smaller ones do most incidents involve 17 to 21 year olds through lack of control whereas 25 plus riders have more concentration and the ability to see oncoming danger and react more quickly

attributes.action: Impose mandatory custodial sentences for assaults on Emergency service personnel
attributes.background: To reduce assaults on emergency service personnel a strong deterrent must be in place. Anyone convicted of such an offence should receive a mandatory custodial prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
Emergency service personnel in this country work day in day out, 24 hours a day 365 days a year, putting themselves in life and death situations to help members of the public.

Far to often we see stories on the news of paramedics, police officers and fire fighters being subjected to countless assaults and sustaining injuries affecting their ability to work whilst also reducing the capacity of these services to continue to provide a full service to those who need it.

The only way to reduce this is to send a strong message that it WILL NOT be tolerated and to introduce a strong deterrent to anyone believing they can engage in such behaviour without serious consequences. As such anyone convicted of such a crime should be handed a mandatory custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for Group Strep B to be tested in every pregnancy
attributes.background: Group Strep B can be fatal to newborns and can be picked up during pregnancy. All it takes is a simple blood test (which are done in early stages anyway) or a swab. This needs to be made mandatory so it can be dealt with in the correct way during labour and afterbirth etc. Please help make it happen

attributes.action: Set up an independent commission to draft a new Representation of the People Act
attributes.background: Increasingly we are being asked to choose between extreme positions defined by the grassroots of both parties. Eg, holding a referendum without any predefined implementation plans means that, at this critical time in our history, the UK's future will be decided by 150,000 Conservative Party members.
attributes.additional_details: The old party models no longer correspond to the reality of 21st century society. We need a full reform of the electoral and parliamentary systems, possibly with some form of proportional or alternative voting system, and with a second house that could be selected across the whole of society by something akin to jury service. To decide what reforms are needed, an independent commission should be set up to propose a major overhaul of the system by means of a new Reform Act.
